node.title: Predator control sees native bird life double on West Coast
node.description: Native bird numbers have reached new highs in the Department of Conservation's longest running bird monitoring project.

node.title: New South Wales records 1 million Covid-19 cases in just over two months
node.description: New South Wales took about two years to officially reach 1 million Covid-19 cases, to get to 2 million cases it only took about two and a half months.

node.title: Ukranian civilians in Luhansk region told to flee immediately as Russian forces amass
node.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy says they are ready for a tough battle with Russian forces amassing in the east of the country, and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has offered fresh…

node.title: Oranga Tamariki campaign raises questions on 'process of engagement'
node.description: The Office of the Children's Commissioner is concerned about Oranga Tamariki's new Hear Me, See Me campaign.

node.title: Vintage radio auction goes live, bids start at $10
node.description: Hundreds of vintage radios that were part of a private collection in Auckland are being sold under the hammer.

node.title: Groundwork being done for drone network in Christchurch
node.description: A concept plan is being developed for a city-wide drone network.

node.title: Heritage sticking point sees city councillor dropped from Green ticket
node.description: A Wellington city councillor will this year run as an independent, after being voted out as a candidate for the Green Party.

node.title: Imran Khan ousted as Pakistan's prime minister after key vote
node.description: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan has been ousted from power after losing a no-confidence vote in his leadership.

node.title: 5-alarm fire engulfs Home Depot in San José, California
node.description: Dozens of firefighters were on hand to battle the blaze as crowds gathered in the parking lot to watch.

node.title: "Puppet master" wife orchestrated husband's murder-for hire
node.description: Jamie Faith was ambushed - shot seven times while walking his dog. Why did his wife, Jennifer, want him dead – and had she attempted it before?

node.title: Fire crews quickly contain second blaze to stop it merging with Awarua fire
node.description: Fire crews have worked quickly to stop a second fire merging with the nearby Awarua Bay fire, near Invercargill this morning.

node.title: Two people dead and three others injured in separate crashes
node.description: It's been a deadly Saturday on New Zealand roads, with two killed and three others injured in separate crashes.

node.title: UK defence ministry says Russia targeting civilians in Ukraine
node.description: The British defence ministry said that Russian forces were targeting civilians, a day after a missile attack on a train station killed 52 civilians.

node.title: Central Christchurch occupiers taking green space from residents - councillor
node.description: A Christchurch city councillor is calling for pro-active enforcement from the council and police to end an anti-mandate occupation in the central city.

node.title: Home and community support services under threat following pay equity settlement
node.description: The home and community support sector says more funding is essential if its services are to be maintained.

node.title: Blues thump Chiefs to win six straight as Crusaders pip Hurricanes
node.description: The Blues beat the Chiefs 25-0 in Hamilton on Saturday night as they kept the hosts scoreless for the first time in Super Rugby history.

node.title: Maryland lawmakers override governor's veto of abortion access
node.description: The measure comes at a time when the conservative majority on the U.S. Supreme Court is weighing whether to overturn Roe v. Wade.

node.title: Fewer than 12,000 foreign students remain in New Zealand
node.description: Immigration New Zealand figures show fewer than 12,000 foreign students remain in the country.

node.title: Man United and Arsenal slip up, Chelsea score six and Spurs win
node.description: Manchester United and Arsenal's Premier League top-four hopes were hit by defeats as Chelsea bounced back from their Champions League loss at Southampton.

node.title: Woody debris on Gisborne beaches again after recent flooding
node.description: The Gisborne mayor says prosecutions are possible if debris found on beaches following the recent flooding can be traced to a breach of a resource consent.

node.title: Covid-19 cases expected to climb again during winter
node.description: People's behaviour, waning immunity and any new variants will influence Covid-19 case numbers over winter, a modeller says.

node.title: 'Don't be a jerk': Badly behaved passengers hit with record fines
node.description: Two airline passengers accused of "unruly behaviour" have been hit with the largest fines ever proposed by the US Federal Aviation Administration.

node.title: Travel chaos for third day in a row at Sydney Airport
node.description: Sydney Airport has apologised as passengers express frustration over another day of delays.

node.title: Agriculture sector blamed for softer wording in climate change document
node.description: Greenpeace says New Zealand officials at the United Nations recently "sabotaged" efforts to mitigate climate change.

node.title: Jack White marries musician Olivia Jean at Detroit show
node.description: White asked her to marry him during a rendition of the song "Hotel Yorba" and right before the lyric "let's get married."

node.title: Pakistan's prime minister ousted after no confidence vote
node.description: The head of one of the largest opposition parties, the Pakistani Muslim League, will take over as prime minister.

node.title: Leclerc puts Ferrari on pole at Australian Grand Prix
node.description: Charles Leclerc took pole position for Ferrari in crash-laden qualifying for the Australian Grand Prix ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen.

node.title: U.K. prime minister meets with Ukraine's leader in Kyiv
node.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy​ said he was grateful for the prime minister's visit, calling it an important meeting during "very difficult and turbulent times for our country."

node.title: 'It just seems wrong': Council critic wants action on Blue Baths building
node.description: The former leaseholder says it's "not good enough" the council does not have a plan for the closed category one heritage-listed building in Rotorua.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 8531 new cases, 11 deaths, 635 in hospital
node.description: The number of new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand continues to fall, with 8531 new cases reported today, along with 11 further deaths.
